decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of cogent and consistent information that the proposed development (which includes the vehicular crossover) would not harm the health and longevity of mature trees within the site and street trees. Were any harm to occur to trees this would have an unacceptable adverse impact on the character and appearance of the application site and wider Kingston Hill/Coombe Hill Strategic Area of Special Character, contrary to Paragraph 131 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021, Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy 2012, Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD 2013.

The proposed crossover would exceed the maximum width identified in the Vehicle Crossover Policy (April 2020) and it has not been demonstrated that sufficient visibility splays would be incorporated so as to ensure pedestrian and highway safety, contrary to Policies DM9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy, the Council's Sustainable Transport SPD 2013 and the Council's Vehicle Crossover Policy (April 2020) and the NPPF (2021).
description: Removal of rooftop railings and alterations to front elevation of dwelling. Replacement of front boundary fence, installation of new gates and piers, and additional vehicular crossover.
